summary: Bird distribution tracker app for Al Buraimi Governorate. After multiple failed revert/restore attempts (versions 521-528), user is requesting restoration to version 510, which was an earlier stable version. The app title should be 'مواقع انتشار البوم بمحافظة البريمي'.
architectural_notes: Correct app title is 'مواقع انتشار البوم بمحافظة البريمي' (Owl Distribution Sites in Al Buraimi Governorate)
App should include a hamburger menu with navigation links: bird data (البيانات), photo gallery (معرض الصور), locations/map (المواقع), and statistics (الاحصائيات)
known_issues: After version 521 deployment, only one image is displaying; other uploaded images are still missing
After version 523 deployment, previously added data and images are no longer displaying, and page navigation buttons are missing from the interface
After version 524 deployment, all data, images, and the home page have disappeared — full regression reported by user
User requested immediate revert to Draft Version 522 after version 526 deployment
Version 528 deployment failed to restore correct app state — title was wrong and app did not match version 522 functionality; user is now requesting revert to version 510
Version 529 may be missing the hamburger menu with navigation links (bird data, gallery, locations, statistics) that existed in version 510
Dropdown menu 'البيانات' item does not navigate to the bird data page when selected
Version 534 deployment: Add/Edit/Delete/Save action buttons did not appear in BirdDataTable — user requesting re-implementation without changing any other part of the app
Version 538 deployment: Add/Edit/Delete/Save action buttons still did not appear in BirdDataTable — user requesting re-implementation again without changing any other part of the app

existing_features.title: Investigate why uploaded images are not displaying after deployment. Check if blob storage paths, file references, or asset serving mechanisms have changed. Verify that image blob IDs stored in bird records still resolve to accessible image data.

Add frontend error handling and logging to display specific error messages when data fails to load. Show whether the issue is a backend connection problem, empty dataset, or authentication/permission error.

Debug and fix the image display logic in AllLocationsMap.tsx to ensure all uploaded images for each bird location are rendered, not just the first one. Verify the image iteration logic and check if the blob URL generation is working for all image IDs in the images array.

Debug and fix the image display logic in BirdGallery.tsx to ensure all uploaded images are visible in the gallery view, not just one image per bird. Verify that the LazyGalleryGrid component is receiving and rendering all image entries.

Add comprehensive logging to the frontend image rendering components (AllLocationsMap, BirdGallery, BirdDetailsPage) to capture: total number of images expected per bird, number of images successfully rendered, any blob URL generation failures, and whether the backend is returning incomplete image arrays.

Add a 'Return to Home' button to BirdDetailsPage.tsx that navigates the user back to the main home page (HomePage). The button should be visually consistent with the existing Arabic RTL interface and placed prominently at the top or bottom of the page.
Add a 'Return to Home' button to AllLocationsMap.tsx that navigates the user back to the main home page. The button should be accessible and match the existing RTL Arabic interface style.
Add a 'Return to Home' button to BirdGallery.tsx that navigates the user back to the main home page. The button should be styled to match the existing Arabic RTL gallery interface.

Add a 'Return to Home' button to EagleOwlPage.tsx, StatisticsPage.tsx, ImageViewPage.tsx, and PermissionManagement.tsx that each navigate the user back to the main home page. Buttons should be consistently styled across all pages using the existing desert/amber theme and RTL layout.

Audit the frontend App.tsx router configuration to ensure all page routes (AllLocationsMap, BirdGallery, BirdDetailsPage, EagleOwlPage, StatisticsPage, ImageViewPage, PermissionManagement) are correctly registered and functional after the v523 update. Fix any broken or missing route definitions that would cause page navigation buttons to be non-functional or invisible.

Audit and fix the blob storage URL generation pipeline in the frontend. Ensure that image blob IDs retrieved from the backend are correctly resolved into displayable URLs across BirdDetailsPage.tsx, BirdGallery.tsx, and AllLocationsMap.tsx. Check that the useActor hook and blob-fetching logic are initializing correctly after the latest update and are not silently failing.

Add a diagnostic error display layer to the frontend that surfaces specific failure reasons when data or images fail to load after an upgrade. Display whether the failure is a backend connection error, an empty dataset returned post-migration, an authentication/permission error, or a blob resolution failure. This should be visible in the UI (not just in the console) to help identify post-deployment regressions.

Restore the HomePage (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) to its fully functional state, including the hero section with the owl image, all navigation buttons (gallery, map, eagle owl, statistics, permissions), the bird data table, and the static Al Buraimi map. Ensure all sections render correctly on first load without requiring authentication.

Restore the App.tsx TanStack Router configuration to correctly register all routes: home (/), gallery (/gallery), bird details (/bird/:name), map (/map), eagle-owl (/eagle-owl), statistics (/statistics), image view (/image-view), and permissions (/permissions). Ensure lazy loading and error boundaries are intact and all navigation buttons on the home page route to the correct pages.

Restore the blob storage URL generation pipeline across BirdDetailsPage.tsx, BirdGallery.tsx, and AllLocationsMap.tsx so that images stored in blob storage are correctly fetched and rendered. Ensure the useActor hook initializes correctly and blob IDs from bird records resolve into displayable image URLs without silent failures.

Restore the SplashScreen component (frontend/src/components/SplashScreen.tsx) and ensure it displays correctly on first visit with the owl image, Arabic title, and the animated enter button. Verify that clicking the enter button transitions the user to the home page content without a blank screen.

Verify and restore role-based access control so that the admin user with principal ID '5uylz-j7fcd-isj73-gp57f-xwwyy-po2ib-7iboa-fdkdv-nrsam-3bd3r-qqe' retains admin privileges after the v524 upgrade. Ensure the admin link is visible in MainHeader when authenticated and that write operations in BirdDataTable are accessible to this principal.

Restore the HomePage (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) to its fully functional state, including the splash screen (shown once per session), hero section with owl image, all navigation buttons (gallery, map, eagle owl, statistics, permissions), the bird data table, the static Al Buraimi map, and the team data table. Ensure all sections render correctly on first load without requiring authentication.

Restore the blob storage URL generation pipeline across BirdDetailsPage.tsx, BirdGallery.tsx, and AllLocationsMap.tsx so that all images stored in blob storage are correctly fetched and rendered. Ensure the useActor hook initializes correctly and blob IDs from bird records resolve into displayable image URLs without silent failures. All uploaded images per bird must be displayed, not just the first one.

Verify and restore role-based access control so that the admin user with principal ID '5uylz-j7fcd-isj73-gp57f-xwwyy-po2ib-7iboa-fdkdv-nrsam-3bd3r-qqe' retains admin privileges after the upgrade. Ensure the admin link is visible in MainHeader when authenticated and that write operations in BirdDataTable are accessible to this principal.

Ensure 'Return to Home' navigation buttons are present and functional on all secondary pages: BirdDetailsPage.tsx, BirdGallery.tsx, AllLocationsMap.tsx, EagleOwlPage.tsx, StatisticsPage.tsx, ImageViewPage.tsx, and PermissionManagement.tsx. Buttons must be styled consistently using the existing desert/amber theme and RTL layout.

Revert the entire project — both backend (backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo) and all frontend source files — to the exact state of Draft Version 522. No new modifications, fixes, or feature additions should be applied during this revert. The result must be a faithful restoration of the Draft Version 522 codebase, including all bird records, blob storage, role-based access control, navigation buttons, image display pipelines, splash screen, and homepage sections that were present and functional at that version.

Revert the entire project — both backend (backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo) and all frontend source files — to the exact state of Draft Version 510. No new modifications, fixes, or feature additions should be applied during this revert. The result must be a faithful restoration of the Draft Version 510 codebase, including all bird records, blob storage, role-based access control, navigation buttons, image display pipelines, splash screen, and homepage sections that were present and functional at that version.

Restore the hamburger menu (mobile/responsive navigation drawer) in the app that contains navigation links to: Bird Data (البيانات), Photo Gallery (معرض الصور), Locations/Map (المواقع), and Statistics (الاحصائيات). The menu must be accessible via a hamburger icon button in the header, open as a dropdown or side drawer on click, and close when a navigation item is selected. Style it consistently with the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme as it existed in version 510.

Add a horizontal scrollable data table to the bird data page (BirdDataTable.tsx or HomePage.tsx bird data section) with the following columns in order: Local Name (الاسم المحلي), Scientific Name (الاسم العلمي), English Name (الاسم بالانجليزي), Location (الموقع), Coordinates (الاحداثيات), Mountain Name (اسم الجبل), Valley Name (اسم الوادي), Governorate (الولاية), Notes (ملاحظات). The table must be RTL-oriented, horizontally scrollable on smaller screens, and styled consistently with the existing desert/amber theme.

Create a new standalone page component at frontend/src/pages/BirdDataPage.tsx that renders the BirdDataTable component (frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx) in a full-page layout. The page must include a 'Return to Home' button styled consistently with the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme. Do not modify BirdDataTable.tsx itself.

Register a new route '/data' in frontend/src/App.tsx that lazy-loads the new BirdDataPage component, wrapped in an ErrorBoundary. Follow the same lazy-loading pattern used for existing routes such as /gallery, /map, and /statistics.

Add a navigation button to the HomePage (frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx) that navigates to the new '/data' route. The button should be labeled 'البيانات' (Bird Data) in Arabic, styled as a navigation card consistent with the existing gallery, map, eagle-owl, and statistics navigation cards already on the home page. Do not change any other part of HomePage.tsx.

Update the HamburgerMenu component (frontend/src/components/HamburgerMenu.tsx) so that clicking 'البيانات' navigates to the '/data' route using TanStack Router, consistent with how other menu items navigate. The menu must close after the item is selected.

Add Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Save (حفظ) action buttons to the bird data table in frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx. The Add button should appear in the table toolbar/header area to create a new bird record row. Each existing row should have an Edit button that switches the row into an editable inline state, a Save button that commits the edits (visible only when a row is in edit mode, replacing the Edit button), and a Delete button that removes the row. All buttons must be styled consistently with the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme used throughout the app. Restrict Add, Edit, Delete, and Save actions to authenticated admin users only, consistent with the existing access control logic already present in BirdDataTable.tsx. Do not change any other part of the file, any other component, any page, or any route.

Add Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Save (حفظ) action buttons exclusively to frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx. The Add button must appear in the table toolbar/header area to create a new empty bird record row. Each existing data row must show an Edit button that switches that row into an inline editable state. When a row is in edit mode, the Edit button must be replaced by a Save button that commits the changes to the backend. Each row must also have a Delete button that removes the record. All buttons must be styled consistently with the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme already used in BirdDataTable.tsx. All four actions must be restricted to authenticated admin users only, using the same access-control logic (principal/role check) already present in BirdDataTable.tsx. No other file, component, page, or route may be modified.

Fix the Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Save (حفظ) action buttons in frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx so they are visible and functional for authenticated admin users. The Add button must appear in the table toolbar/header area. Each data row must show an Edit button that switches the row into inline edit mode; in edit mode the Edit button is replaced by a Save button that commits changes to the backend. Each row must also have a Delete button. All buttons must use the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme already in BirdDataTable.tsx. All four actions must be restricted to authenticated admin users only using the same principal/role check already present in BirdDataTable.tsx. Do NOT modify any other file, component, page, or route.

In AllLocationsMap.tsx, ensure that bird location pins are rendered on the map for every bird record returned by the backend that has valid coordinate data. Verify that the component correctly reads the location/coordinates fields from each BirdData record and maps them to clickable pins on the static Al Buraimi map image. Do not change any other component, page, route, or backend file.

Fix and ensure the Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Save (حفظ) action buttons are visible and fully functional in frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx for authenticated admin users. The Add button must appear in the table toolbar/header area to create a new empty bird record row. Each existing data row must show an Edit button that switches the row into inline edit mode. When a row is in edit mode, the Edit button must be replaced by a Save button that commits changes to the backend. Each row must also have a Delete button that removes the record. All buttons must be styled consistently with the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme already used in BirdDataTable.tsx. All four actions must be restricted to authenticated admin users only, using the same principal/role check already present in BirdDataTable.tsx. Do NOT modify any other file, component, page, or route.

Fix frontend/src/components/BirdDataTable.tsx so that the Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Save (حفظ), and Delete (حذف) action buttons are visible and fully functional for authenticated admin users. The Add button must appear in the table toolbar/header area. Each data row must show an Edit button that switches the row into inline edit mode; in edit mode the Edit button is replaced by a Save button that commits the changes to the backend. Each row must also have a Delete button. All buttons must be styled using the existing desert/amber RTL Arabic theme already present in the file. All four actions must be restricted to authenticated admin users only using the same principal/role-check logic already in BirdDataTable.tsx. This change must be isolated exclusively to BirdDataTable.tsx — no other file, component, page, route, or backend file may be modified.

new_feature_requests.summary: Investigate why previously added bird data is no longer displaying after the latest deployment to version 520. Check if the backend stable memory migration is correctly preserving existing bird records, user profiles, team data, and access control settings.

Verify that the migration.mo file correctly migrates stable storage from the old actor to the new actor. If migration logic is missing or incomplete, implement proper state transfer for all stable variables including birdData, nextId, users, teams, and blobStorage.

Check if role-based access control and permissions are functioning correctly after deployment. Verify that the user with principal ID '5uylz-j7fcd-isj73-gp57f-xwwyy-po2ib-7iboa-fdkdv-nrsam-3bd3r-qqe' still has admin privileges and can view/edit data.

Verify that the backend canister configuration and HTTP asset serving are correctly set up in the live environment. Check if CORS settings, asset certification, or canister permissions have changed compared to the draft environment.

Debug and fix the image display logic in BirdDetailsPage.tsx to ensure all images associated with a specific bird are shown, not just a single image. Check if the image array mapping and blob URL generation is working correctly for multiple images.

Verify in the backend that when getBirdData() is called, it returns the complete images array for each bird record, not truncated or filtered data. Add logging to confirm the full image blob ID arrays are being sent to the frontend.
Add 'Return to Home' buttons across pages to allow users to navigate back to the main/home page.

Audit and fix the backend stable memory migration so that all previously stored bird records (including birdData, nextId, users, teams, blobStorage, and access control settings) are fully preserved across canister upgrades. Ensure migration.mo correctly transfers all stable variables from the pre-upgrade state to the post-upgrade state without data loss.

Verify and fix the backend getBirdData() function to ensure it returns the complete and untruncated images array for every bird record. Add backend-side logging (via Debug.print) to confirm the full blob ID arrays are included in each returned BirdData record.

Audit and restore the backend stable memory migration in migration.mo to ensure all previously stored data — birdData, nextId, users, teams, blobStorage, mapReferenceId, and access control settings — is fully preserved across canister upgrades from the pre-v524 state. Fix any missing or broken state transfer logic that caused data loss after the v524 deployment.

Restore the backend getBirdData() function to return complete, untruncated bird records including full images arrays, audio blob IDs, location coordinates, and all metadata fields. Add Debug.print logging on the backend to confirm full blob ID arrays are included in each returned BirdData record.

Restore the backend stable memory migration in migration.mo to fully preserve all stable variables — birdData, nextId, users, teams, blobStorage, mapReferenceId, and access control settings — from the pre-upgrade state so that all previously stored bird records, images, and user data survive canister upgrades without loss.

Restore the backend getBirdData() function to return complete, untruncated bird records including full images arrays, audio blob IDs, location coordinates, and all metadata fields. Add Debug.print logging on the backend to confirm full blob ID arrays are included in each returned BirdData record.

Revert the entire project — both backend (backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo) and all frontend source files — to the exact state of Draft Version 522. No new modifications, fixes, or feature additions should be applied during this revert. The result must be a byte-for-byte restoration of the Draft Version 522 codebase.

Revert/restore the entire project to the state of Draft Version 510, which was a known stable version. The app title must be 'مواقع انتشار البوم بمحافظة البريمي'. No new modifications should be applied during this revert.
Restore the hamburger menu containing navigation links to: bird data, photo gallery, locations/map, and statistics — as it existed in version 510.

Add a horizontal data table to the bird data page with columns: Local Name (الاسم المحلي), Scientific Name (الاسم العلمي), English Name (الاسم بالانجليزي), Location (الموقع), Coordinates (الاحداثيات), Mountain Name (اسم الجبل), Valley Name (اسم الوادي), Governorate (الولاية), Notes (ملاحظات).

Ensure the backend BirdData type exposes the fields required for the new table columns: local name, scientific name, English name, location, coordinates, mountain name, valley name, governorate, and notes. If any of these fields are missing from the BirdData record type in backend/main.mo, add them as optional or required fields and update the getBirdData() query to return them.
Fix the dropdown/hamburger menu navigation so that clicking 'البيانات' (Bird Data) correctly navigates to the bird data page.

Fix the 'البيانات' (Bird Data) navigation item in HamburgerMenu.tsx so that clicking it correctly navigates the user to the bird data page (the home page section or dedicated route where BirdDataTable is rendered). The item currently opens the dropdown but does not trigger any navigation. Ensure the navigation method is consistent with the router used in App.tsx (TanStack Router) and that the menu closes after selection.

Add a new standalone page for displaying the bird data table. Move the data section from the home page to this new page. Add a navigation button on the home page to go to the new data page. Do not change the home page design or any existing functionality.
Add Add (إضافة), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Save (حفظ) action buttons to the bird data table (BirdDataTable.tsx) without changing anything else.
Sync bird location data with the map so that bird records appear as markers on the map view, without changing any other part of the app.
Without changing anything else, add Save (حفظ), Edit (تعديل), Delete (حذف), and Edit/Modify (تحرير) action buttons to the bird data table in the data page (BirdDataTable.tsx).
